meanings.definition: A place where vehicles are stopped and checked for compliance with traffic laws.
meanings.sent1: At the checkstop, the police officers made sure all drivers had their seat belts on.
meanings.sent2: The checkstop on the highway helped ensure that all vehicles were following the speed limit.
meanings.sent3: The checkstop was like a gatekeeper, only allowing those who followed the rules to pass through.
meanings.sent4: The checkstop stood like a guardian, watching over the road for any violations.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the checkstop made it impossible to miss for any driver.

meanings.definition: To stop and inspect something for accuracy or correctness.
meanings.sent1: I need to checkstop the measurements before we proceed with the construction.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will checkstop our homework to make sure we did it correctly.
meanings.sent3: He decided to checkstop his calculations one more time to avoid any mistakes.
meanings.sent4: She had to checkstop her work to ensure it met the quality standards.
meanings.sent5: The chef will checkstop the ingredients to guarantee a delicious dish.
